text: The is a Japanese treasure house in the Tōdai-ji temple complex at NaraImperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), 正倉院ホームページ; retrieved 2012-6-17. It is close to the building which houses the Great Buddha (Diabutsuden). It is the oldest museum structure in the world.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Museums" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 671-672. == History == The earliest objects in the Shōsō-in were put there by Empress Kōmyō (701–760). The collection includes artifacts from the arts and crafts of the Tempyō era. The building was built in the with a raised floor . ==References== ==Other websites== * Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), Imperial Household Agency page for Shōsōin * University of California, Irvine, Shosoin Imperial Repository. Category:Museums in Japan Category:World Heritage Sites in Japan Category:Nara Prefecture
title: Shōsōin
